snippet: The company raised its 2014 profit forecast for the second time since January, again up by a nickel to a range of $5.85 to $5.92 per share, excluding one-time items.
abstract: Strong sales of several new drugs lift Johnson & Johnson's second-quarter profit by 13 percent, topping analysts' expectations; J&J reports earnings increased to $4.33 billion, or $1.51 per share, from $3.83 billion, or $1.33 per share, year earlier.
lead_paragraph: The company raised its 2014 profit forecast for the second time since January, again up by a nickel to a range of $5.85 to $5.92 per share, excluding one-time items.

headline.main: Sales of New Drugs Increase Johnson & Johnson Profit 13%
headline.print_headline: Sales of New Drugs Increase Johnson & Johnson Profit 13%
